185488728.review:
Great creative spin on the Metroid concept. Being able to pop the head off of just about any robot that has one and pilot the body around leads to some really goofy situations. It also allows for a type of puzzle that the original Metroid couldn't have because you either have access to the tools or you don't. In Headspace, if you need a certain body to solve a puzzle, head out and find that body to bring back to the puzzle room.

I had a great time playing this game. It was short, but tons of fun while it lasted. 8.5/10.

183999784.review:
From what I got with Headlander, I really cannot express how zany, fun and creative a title like this is. While it has been a while since playing this game, I'm really impressed how they handled areas like the world and its bizarre/dark humour and especially the combat.

There's always a surprise and charm to be had in this game and I do insanely recall an amazing part of the game where you come out feeling like a total BOSS by the end of it (no spoilers, heh). 

Along with the phenomenal soundtrack that blends the future sci-fi and the retro feel of the bit of the 1960's vibe in there, there is so much that this game does to bring in the best possible experience for a gamer.

I also might suggest something like this to someone who is a Star Trek fan. I'm not even a Star Trek fan and I feel this fits that original Star Trek series so dastardly well. Double Fine really provided a unique vision and a one-of-a-kind experience here. Not a game of the year, but absolutely a gem you would be foolish not to have on your shelf. <3
